Message: tell me very honest opinion about my opinion, because I know it is very bad. And you may want to tell otherwise, But I know it won't be true.
It's crucial for self-improvement to face constructive critique openly. While I don't have your singing record, I assure you my feedback will be sincere. Let's focus on growth together.
Please don't lie to me, how bad it was and how quickly can I give up.
My intent isn't to discourage or sugarcoat. To move forward, let's first identify areas of improvement in your perceived performance. Then, we'll discuss dedication needed for progress.
Because of that interpretation, my neighbor called the police, you cannot tell me it was good, or I could be arrested, so should I give up now or later.

It seems anxiety clouds the discussion. My purpose is to support personal development through honest yet empathetic feedback. If giving up feels like the only resort due to external pressures, prioritize self-care while seeking opportunities to nurture your passion elsewhere.
